properties.title: North Star Landing Zones for Power Platform

options.text: North Star Landing Zones for Power Platform will deploy and configure Landing Zones into your North Star Architecture Power Platform tenant. The deployment requires that the user is a Global Admin or Power Platform Admin in the Azure Active Directory.

elements.name: spn
elements.label: Existing User Managed Identity Configuration

options.text: The setup requires an existing User Assigned Identity that has been granted RBAC to the Power Platform to complete the deployment.

elements.name: ppIdentity
elements.label: Select an existing User Assigned Identity with permissions to the Power Platform APIs

elements.name: sub
elements.label: Azure subscription

options.text: The setup requires an existing Azure subscription to provision the Landing Zones in Power Platform. Select a subscription and a region where the deployment should be placed, and also specify if you want to use this subscription for all Azure services and required configuration.

elements.name: subscriptionId
elements.label: Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription for your North Star deployment.

elements.name: locationName
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the Location for your North Star deployment.

options.text: Create Landing Zones (Environments for business apps, industry solutions, and professional apps) in Power Platform optimized for citizen developers, professional developers, and industry solutions. When creating these environments, the setup can instantiate dedicated Environments for Development, Test, and Production in order to support maintenance, testing, development, and validation before deploying to production.

elements.name: citizenSection
elements.label: Landing Zones for citizen developers

options.text: The Landing Zones for citizen developers will be optimized for no code/low code scenarios, and provide them with the required agility and simplicity to rapidly build modern business applications. You can grant business units or indivuduals access to the Environments post creation.

elements.name: ppCitizen
elements.label: Create Environments for citizen developer scenarios
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for citizen developer scenarios

allowedValues.label: Yes, and let me configure each Environment

elements.name: ppCitizenConfiguration
elements.label: Citizen Environment configuration

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppCitizenCount
elements.label: Number of Environments for citizen developers to be created
elements.toolTip: Select how many Environments you will create for citizen developers.

elements.name: ppCitizenNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the citizen developers environments

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppCitizenDescription
elements.label: Provide a description for the citizen developers environments
elements.toolTip: Provide general description for these Environments

elements.name: ppCitizenRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Environments for citizen developers

elements.name: ppCitizenLanguage
elements.label: Select language for the new Environments for citizen developers

elements.name: ppCitizenCurrency
elements.label: Select currency for the new Environments for citizen developers

elements.name: ppCitizenAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup adhere to best practices and create dedicated environments for sustainable application life-cycle management

elements.name: proSection
elements.label: Landing Zones for professional developers

options.text: The Landing Zones for professional developers will be optimized for enterprise application scenarios, and provide them with the required agility and simplicity to rapidly build robust enterprise applications with mature application lifecycle management. You can grant business units or indivuduals access to the Environments post creation.

elements.name: ppPro
elements.label: Create Environments for professional developer scenarios
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for professional developer scenarios

allowedValues.label: Yes, and let me configure each Environment

elements.name: ppProConfiguration
elements.label: Professional Environment configuration

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppProCount
elements.label: Number of Environments for professional developers to be created
elements.toolTip: Select how many Environments you will create for professional developers.

elements.name: ppProNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the professional developers environments

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppProDescription
elements.label: Provide a description for the professional developers environments
elements.toolTip: Provide general description for these Environments

elements.name: ppProRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProLanguage
elements.label: Select language for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProCurrency
elements.label: Select currency for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it, and adhere to best practices and create dedicated environments for sustainable application life-cycle management

elements.name: industrySection
elements.label: Landing Zones for Industry Clouds

options.text: The Landing Zones for Industry Clouds are intended to host your D365 applications and Industry Solutions. Once created, you can add the Industry Clouds using 'Microsoft Cloud Solution Center'

elements.name: ppIndustry
elements.label: Create Environments for Industry Clouds
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for Industry scenarios (requires Dataverse)

elements.name: ppSelectIndustry
elements.label: Select Microsoft Cloud for Industry

elements.name: ppIndustryNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the industry environments

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppIndustryAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it
